text: Sander Gard Bolin Berge (born 14 February 1998) is a Norwegian professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for club Sheffield United. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Berge was born in Bærum, Viken. He started his career playing youth football for Asker Fotball, making his senior debut in the end of the 2013 season for the team then playing in the Norwegian 2. divisjon (3rd tier). He joined top flight team Vålerenga before the 2015 season. Berge made his league debut coming off the bench against Sandefjord on 11 July 2015 and his first league start against Rosenborg, quickly establishing himself as a key player for the club. On 2 January 2017, he signed a four-year contract with K.R.C. Genk. He made his first team league debut on 21 January as a substitute in the 0–1 win away against Eupen. He earned his first start and full match against Royal Excel Mouscron on 17 February in a 1–0 win at home, becoming an integral part of the team for the remaining season, which included an impressive run in the Europa League, ending in the quarter finals against Celta Vigo.https://www.whoscored.com/Players/321020/Fixtures/Sander-Berge ===Sheffield United=== On 30 January 2020, Berge signed for Sheffield United, becoming their record signing in the process. He signed on a four-and-a-half year contract. On 2 July, Berge scored his first goal for Sheffield United in a 3–1 win against Tottenham Hotspur. ==International career== Berge made his debut for Norway when he played for the under-15 team against Canada U15 on 2 May 2013. He has later represented Norway at every level up to under-21. He made his senior team debut 23 March 2017 aged 19, coming on as a substitute in the 76th minute of the Euro-qualifier against Northern Ireland. On 5 September 2019, Sander Berge scored his first international goal for Norway against Malta in the UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying rounds in the 34th minute. ==Personal life== Sander Berge comes from a basketball-playing family, with his father, Swedish mother and older brother all having played basketball at international level. His brother has also played for top flight teams Centrum Tigers and Asker Aliens.https://www.vg.no/sport/fotball/landslaget/sander-berge-og- storebroren-storspiller-i-hver-sin-idrett/a/24149144/ Berge is also the grandson of Ragnar Berge, who played as a left-back for Vålerenga from 1945 until 1957, and was capped once by Norway (in 1955).I bestefars fotspor , Vålerenga Fotball (10 February 2015) ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !rowspan="2"|Division !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|Europe !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goal!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="3"|Asker |2013 |rowspan="2"|2. divisjon |1||0||0||0 |0 |0||1||0 |- |2014 |7||0||1||0 |0 |0||8||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !8!!0!!1!!0!!0!!0!!9!!0 |- |rowspan="3"|Vålerenga |2015 |rowspan="2"|Tippeligaen |11||0||2||1 |0 |0||13||1 |- |2016 |25||0||5||0 |0 |0||30||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !36!!0!!7!!1!!0!!0!!43!!1 |- |rowspan="5"|Genk |2016–17 |rowspan="4"|Belgian First Division A |9||0||2||0||6||0||17||0 |- |2017–18 |13||0||1||0||0||0||14||0 |- |2018–19 |28||0||2||0||10||2||40||2 |- |2019–20 |23||4||1||0||6||0||30||4 |- !colspan=2|Total !73!!4!!6!!0!!22!!2!!101!!6 |- |rowspan="3"|Sheffield United |2019–20 |rowspan="2"|Premier League |14||1||2||0||0||0||16||1 |- |2020–21 |5||0||1||0||0||0||6||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !19!!1!!3!!0!!0!!0!!22!!1 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !136!!5!!17!!1!!22!!2!!174!!8 |} ===International=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- |colspan="3"|Norway |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |2017||7||0 |- |2018||5||0 |- |2019||8||1 |- |2020||3||0 |- !Total!!23!!1 |} :Norway score listed first, score column indicates score after each Berge goal. {| class="wikitable" !
